metadata.title: CVE-2024-5693 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Offscreen Canvas did not properly track cross-origin tainting, which couldbe used to access image data from another site in violation of same-originpolicy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, andThunderbird < 115.12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.12.0+build3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
